docs.snippet: 9:50 A.M. (HBO Signature) THE AMERICAN (2010) Before ''The Descendants'' and ''The Ides of March'' brought him Oscar nominations in this latest awards season, George Clooney, above, played a gun-toting expatriate who arrives in a small Italian tow...
docs.lead_paragraph: 9:50 A.M. (HBO Signature) THE AMERICAN (2010) Before ''The Descendants'' and ''The Ides of March'' brought him Oscar nominations in this latest awards season, George Clooney, above, played a gun-toting expatriate who arrives in a small Italian town after a mishap on his previous job and takes an assignment to build a custom weapon for a sexy assassin (Thekla Reuten). ''I'm out,'' he says at one point, intent on making the kind of human connection that his taciturn temperament and job -- as a hit man, perhaps -- have denied him until now. Soon he has made friends with a priest (Paolo Bonacelli) and a prostitute (Violante Placido), who is so enamored of his prowess in bed that she stops charging him. The film, directed by Anton Corbijn from a script by Rowan Joffe, by ''filtering out any mention of the character's history and suppressing all but the tiniest indications of emotion, tries to strip the man to his essence,'' A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. ''But there is not quite enough there: the still waters run very cool but not terribly deep, and 'The American' falls back into a view of its protagonist that is ultimately more sentimental than unsettling or intriguing.'' 9 A.M. (Cinemax) WALL STREET: MONEY NEVER SLEEPS (2010) In this sequel to Oliver Stone's 1987 drama, ''Wall Street,'' Michael Douglas, right, returns as the reptilian Gekko, the ruthless corporate raider who, after serving an eight-year prison sentence, has landed in the public spotlight once again for writing a critical and prescient book about the state of the markets. Shia LaBeouf is the investment banker Jake Moore, one of Gekko's fans and the live-in love of Gekko's estranged daughter (Carey Mulligan). Frank Langella is the old-school broker who has been like a father to Jake. And Josh Brolin is the newest snake in town. Let the games resume.

docs.snippet: Even the two main candidates in this spring’s French presidential election took a break from their mudslinging to join the country’s joyous reaction over the success of “The Artist” at the Oscars....
docs.lead_paragraph: Even the two main candidates in this spring’s French presidential election took a break from their mudslinging to join the country’s joyous reaction over the success of “The Artist” at the Oscars.
docs.abstract: French national pride swells after The Artist wins five Academy Awards.

headline.seo: France Cheers Oscars for ‘The Artist’ and Jean Dujardin
headline.main: Wouah! The French Cheer as One for the Oscar-Winning ‘Artist’
headline.print_headline: Wouah! The French Cheer as One for the Oscar-Winning ‘Artist’

docs.snippet: The TV Watch column in some editions on Monday, about the telecast of the Academy Awards ceremony, where Octavia Spencer won the Oscar for best supporting actress for her performance in ''The Help,'' misstated part of the title of a 1967 film to w...
docs.lead_paragraph: The TV Watch column in some editions on Monday, about the telecast of the Academy Awards ceremony, where Octavia Spencer won the Oscar for best supporting actress for her performance in ''The Help,'' misstated part of the title of a 1967 film to which ''The Help'' was compared. It is ''Guess Who's Coming to Dinner,'' not ''Guess Whose Coming to Dinner.''

docs.snippet: The loss of its contract with Starz for movies may hurt Netflix less than originally thought, because more than half of its streaming audience is watching TV series....
docs.lead_paragraph: The loss of its contract with Starz for movies may hurt Netflix less than originally thought, because more than half of its streaming audience is watching TV series.
docs.abstract: Loss of Netflix's contract with Starz for movies may hurt it less than originally thought, because more than half of its streaming audience is watching TV series; analysts say the prioritizing of television partly explains why the company has been able to retain about 21.7 million streaming customers in the United States despite complaints about an inadequate feature film selection.

headline.seo: Once Film-Focused, Netflix Shifts to TV Shows
headline.main: Once Film-Focused, Netflix Transitions to TV Shows
headline.print_headline: Once Film-Focused, Netflix Transitions to TV Shows

docs.snippet: With early ratings for Sunday’s telecast essentially flat, Hollywood started coming to grips with one of its biggest worries: Is this the new normal for the Academy Awards?...
docs.lead_paragraph: With early ratings for Sunday’s telecast essentially flat, Hollywood started coming to grips with one of its biggest worries: Is this the new normal for the Academy Awards?
docs.abstract: Academy Awards ceremony telecast fails to improve its ratings this year, possibly because it was dominated by movies that relatively few Americans have seen or because younger viewers find the show itself boring.

headline.seo: Oscars’ Flat TV Ratings Worry Hollywood
headline.main: Fears Grow That Oscars’ TV Allure May Be Resistible
headline.print_headline: Fears Grow That Oscars’ TV Allure May Be Resistible
